title: Best Hamburger Ever Recipe
description: The best burger recipe you'll make all summer! These juicy hamburgers are bursting with flavor thanks to onion, cheese, herbs, and lots of seasonings.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Burger Recipes Hamburgers Best Hamburger Ever 4.4 (791) 657 Reviews 35 Photos The best burger recipe for summertime grilling! This juicy burger is jam-packed with all kinds of stuff and has no tasteless bread crumbs. Serve on buns with your favorite condiments. Submitted by UNIVSTUDENT Updated on October 11, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 35 35 35 35 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 hamburgers Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This hamburger recipe is flavorful, juicy, and incredibly satisfying.  Hamburger Ingredients These are the ingredients you’ll need to make this top-rated hamburger recipe:  Beef: These basic burgers start with 1 ½ pounds of lean ground beef. Onion: A finely chopped onion takes the flavor up a notch. Cheese: You’ll need shredded Colby Jack or Cheddar cheese. Egg: An egg lends moisture and helps bind the patties together. Seasonings, herbs, and sauces: These hamburgers are flavored with an envelope of dry onion soup mix, fresh garlic, garlic powder, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, dried parsley, dried basil, dried oregano, crushed dried rosemary, salt, and pepper. How to Make the Best Burgers You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make the best burgers ever:  Combine the ingredients in a bowl. Make four patties. Grill the patties until the juices run clear and the meat is no longer pink in the center.  How Long to Cook Hamburgers Cooked on a grill heated to high heat, these hamburger patties should be fully cooked after about 4 to 5 minutes per side. You’ll know they’re done when the juices run clear, they’re no longer pink in the center, and an instant-read thermometer reads at least 165 degrees F. What to Serve With Hamburgers Explore our collection of Quick and Easy Side Dishes for Burgers for delicious serving inspiration. Here are a few of the crowd-pleasing ideas you’ll find:  Oven-Fresh Seasoned Potato Wedges  Simple Pasta Salad  Perfect BBQ Baked Beans  How to Store Hamburgers Let your leftover hamburger patties cool, then store them in an airtight container for up to three days in the fridge. Reheat in the oven or microwave, then assemble the burgers with fresh buns and toppings just before serving.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “These are absolutely the best hamburger patties from start to finish,” raves hlippmann. “I had all the ingredients on hand and they grilled for 4 1/2 minutes each side! Delicious!!” “So juicy and easy to make,” according to one Allrecipes community member. “My husband loved them, and I'm not usually the burger cooker. We didn't have onion soup mix, so I just added some extra onion powder and it turned out perfect!” “They mix up quickly,” says another reviewer. “We left the cheese out of the mix as my daughter can not have dairy, and they still mixed and held together well.” Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 ½ pounds lean ground beef ½ onion, finely chopped ½ cup shredded Colby Jack or Cheddar cheese 1 large egg 1 (1 ounce) envelope dry onion soup mix 1 clove garlic, minced 1 tablespoon garlic powder 1 teaspoon soy sauce 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon dried parsley 1 teaspoon dried basil 1 teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon crushed dried rosemary salt and pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, combine ground beef, onion, cheese, egg, onion soup mix, minced garlic, garlic powder, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, parsley, basil, oregano, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Use your hands to form the mixture into 4 patties. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook patties on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,175 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 445 Calories 28g Fat 9g Carbs 39g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 445 % Daily Value * Total Fat 28g 35% Saturated Fat 12g 60% Cholesterol 174mg 58% Sodium 967mg 42% Total Carbohydrate 9g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 2g Protein 39g 78% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 171mg 13% Iron 4mg 22% Potassium 517mg 11% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Best Hamburger Ever 01 of 35 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 35 Photo by  CheekyJuice6863 11/15/2023 Did 2 different hamburgers but they were great! 03 of 35 Photo by  lutzflcat 07/04/2023 I read the reviews and was surprised that so many people didn’t understand that when you add this many ingredients to ground beef, it will not be what most consider a “classic hamburger.” But that doesn’t mean that it won’t taste good. I mixed all of the dry ingredients together (did leave out the rosemary) to avoid overworking the meat and to get everything incorporated. No complaints from us, this grilled up to be a juicy, tasty sandwich, even if it wasn’t traditional. 04 of 35 Photo by  Gerry Jurrens 05/25/2022 My Susanne made sliders from this recipe and served them on Hawaiian rolls. OMG! Best ever is not an overstatement! Truly fantastic! 05 of 35 Photo by  alecwatson 01/17/2022 06 of 35 Photo by  Felix Murillo 06/27/2021 07 of 35 Photo by  Alyssa Browder 10/08/2020 08 of 35 Photo by  Keith Brewer 05/06/2020 09 of 35 Photo by  Michelle 04/08/2020 10 of 35 Photo by  Julie Huddleston 09/21/2019 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Chris' Bay Area Burger 905 Ratings Basil Burgers 81 Ratings The Juiciest Hamburgers Ever 78 Ratings Whiskey Hamburgers 90 Ratings Ranch Burgers 789 Ratings Delicious Grilled Hamburgers 168 Ratings Lea's Hamburgers 45 Ratings Beer Burgers 107 Ratings Best Burger Ever 166 Ratings Tex-Mex Burger with Cajun Mayo 467 Ratings Game Day Hamburgers 118 Ratings Jan's Blueberry and Flax Burgers (Paleo) Garlic Mushroom Burgers 8 Ratings All-American Burger Dog 38 Ratings Specials 22 Ratings Maui Wowie Shrimp 66 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
